bug.author: karlschriek
bug.summary: sklearn-iris InferenceService fails to reach ready stage in KF 1.2: "waiting for loadbalancer"
bug.description:
/kind bug After rolling out KF 1.2.0 on EKS (Kubernetes 1.18) I attempted the sklearn-iris KFServing example, as follows: <denchmark-code>apiVersion: "serving.kubeflow.org/v1alpha2" kind: "InferenceService" metadata: name: "sklearn-iris" namespace: mynamespace annotations: sidecar.istio.io/inject: "false" spec: default: predictor: sklearn: storageUri: "gs://kfserving-samples/models/sklearn/iris" </denchmark-code>
The underlying pods as well as knative Service become ready. However, the knative Route and KFServing InferenceService get stuck "waiting for loadbalancer". <denchmark-code>kind: Route apiVersion: serving.knative.dev/v1alpha1 ... status: address: url: 'http://sklearn-iris-predictor-default.karl-schriek.svc.cluster.local' conditions: - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:49:34Z' status: 'True' type: AllTrafficAssigned - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:51:33Z' message: Waiting for load balancer to be ready reason: Uninitialized status: Unknown type: IngressReady - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:51:33Z' message: Waiting for load balancer to be ready reason: Uninitialized status: Unknown type: Ready observedGeneration: 1 traffic: - latestRevision: true percent: 100 revisionName: sklearn-iris-predictor-default-499vl url: >- http://sklearn-iris-predictor-default-karl-schriek.dev-kubeflow-120.learn-mlops.com </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code> kind: InferenceService apiVersion: serving.kubeflow.org/v1alpha2 ... status: canary: {} conditions: - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:49:34Z' message: Waiting for load balancer to be ready reason: Uninitialized status: Unknown type: DefaultPredictorReady - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:49:03Z' message: Failed to reconcile predictor reason: PredictorHostnameUnknown status: 'False' type: Ready - lastTransitionTime: '2020-12-01T13:49:03Z' message: Failed to reconcile predictor reason: PredictorHostnameUnknown status: 'False' type: RoutesReady default: predictor: name: sklearn-iris-predictor-default-zrxrm </denchmark-code>
I can also confirm that on a KF 1.0.2 rollout with a standalone rollout of KFServing 0.3.0 this problem does not occur. A standalone rollout of 0.4.1 in combination with KF 1.0.2 results in the same problem. Environment:
Istio Version: whatever is rolled out with KF 1.2 Knative Version: whatever is rolled out with KF 1.2 KFServing Version: 0.4.1 (I think) Kubeflow version: KF 1.2 Kfdef: aws_cognito Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.18

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/karlschriek>@karlschriek</denchmark-link> Can you check the logs for istio networking pod?
By the way, I now did a standalone rollout of 0.4.1 with KF 1.2. The above error log is from there.
I just realised that the default KF 1.2 rollout for AWS has Istio 1.1.6. I am not sure if there is a reason for this, but I will try to bump it up to 1.3.1 at least and see what happens.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/PatrickXYS>@PatrickXYS</denchmark-link> is there anything particular to the AWS KFDef that means Istio 1.1.6 is required? According to the documentation, KFServing requires 1.3.1+.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pvaneck>@pvaneck</denchmark-link> has tested 0.4.1 with KF1.2 in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/1575>kubeflow/manifests#1575</denchmark-link> , this should work. I see some suspicious error in above log 2020-12-01T15:11:54.954952759Z {"level":"error","ts":"2020-12-01T15:11:54.954Z","logger":"istiocontroller.istio-ingress-controller.status-manager","caller":"status/status.go:418","msg":"Probing of http://sklearn-iris-predictor-default.karl-schriek.dev-kubeflow-120.learn-mlops.com:80 abandoned, IP: 10.0.2.66:80: the response doesn't contain the "K-Network-Hash" header","commit":"e3941ad","knative.dev/controller":"istio-ingress-controller","stacktrace":"knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status.(*Prober).probeVerifier.func1
	knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status/status.go:418
knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/pkg/network/prober.Do
	knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/pkg/network/prober/prober.go:121
knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status.(*Prober).processWorkItem
	knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status/status.go:364
knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status.(*Prober).Start.func1
	knative.dev/net-istio/vendor/knative.dev/serving/pkg/network/status/status.go:278"}
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karlschriek>@karlschriek</denchmark-link> Can you check which knative version you are running ?

I just bumped Istio up to 1.3.1 and that solved the issue. In the official aws kfdef (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/kfdef/kfctl_aws_cognito.v1.2.0.yaml>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/master/kfdef/kfctl_aws_cognito.v1.2.0.yaml</denchmark-link> ) I had to replace: <denchmark-code> - kustomizeConfig: repoRef: name: manifests path: stacks/aws/application/istio-stack name: istio-stack - kustomizeConfig: repoRef: name: manifests path: stacks/aws/application/cluster-local-gateway name: cluster-local-gateway
with
- kustomizeConfig: repoRef: name: manifests path: stacks/aws/application/istio-1-3-1-stack name: istio-stack - kustomizeConfig: repoRef: name: manifests path: stacks/aws/application/cluster-local-gateway-1-3-1 name: cluster-local-gateway </denchmark-code>
I will open a PR fix this in the kfdef, since currently the default AWS rollout is not compatible with KFServing.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karlschriek>@karlschriek</denchmark-link> Nice! looks like a simple kfdef fix, I believe that does not require releasing a new version of manifests
